The expression \(3^2\) means 3 multiplied by itself, which is \(3 \times 3 = 9\).

The expression \(2^4\) means 2 multiplied by itself four times, which is \(2 \times 2 \times 2 \times 2 = 16\).

description: Calculate the value of the expression \(7 + 5 - 3\).
solution: The expression \(7 + 5 - 3\) can be simplified as follows: First, add 7 and 5 to get \(7 + 5 = 12\). Then subtract 3 to get \(12 - 3 = 9\).

description: Find the result of the expression \(15 - 6 + 2\).
solution: To solve \(15 - 6 + 2\), first subtract 6 from 15 to get \(15 - 6 = 9\). Then add 2 to get \(9 + 2 = 11\).
